pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:5.1: 38. The training rule on finding fault
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were looking at the bowls of others finding fault. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:7.1: “‘I will not look at another’s bowl finding fault,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:8.1: One should not look at the bowl of another finding fault.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect looks at the bowl of another finding fault, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:10.1: The eighth training rule is finished.
